Remove Windows Messenger In Windows Xp

If you’re looking for information on Remove Windows Messenger In Windows Xp , then pull up a chair and buckle down,because this is the article that you’ve been looking for.

In this article, we’re going to talking about Remove Windows Messenger In Windows Xp .

It seems that a lot of people are interested in removing Windows Messenger for some reason, though I strongly recommend against this: In Windows XP, Windows Messenger will be the hub of your connection to the .NET world, and now that this feature is part of Windows, I think we're going to see a lot of .NET Passport-enabled Web sites appearing as well. But if you can't stand the little app, there are a couple of ways to get rid of it, and ensure that it doesn't pop up every time you boot into XP. The best way simply utilizes the previous tip:

If you'd like Windows Messenger to show up in the list of programs you can add and remove from Windows, navigate to C:WINDOWSinf and open sysoc.inf (see the previous tip for more information about this file). You'll see a line that reads:

msmsgs=msgrocm.dll,OcEntry,msmsgs.inf,hide,7

Change this to the following and Windows Messenger will appear in Add or Remove Programs,

then Add/Remove Windows Components, then , and you can remove it for good:

msmsgs=msgrocm.dll,OcEntry,msmsgs.inf,7

Now you’ll be able to Remove Windows Messenger In Windows Xp.

About the Author

Sheraz Butt is a freelance writer whose articles have appear in most major ezines. You can find more of these at: http://www.sbarticlezone.blogspot.com/

How To Create a right-click command prompt option In Windows

If you’re looking for information on How To Create a right-click command prompt option In Windows Xp , then pull up a chair and buckle down,because this is the article that you’ve been looking for.

In this article, we’re going to talking about How To Create a right-click command prompt option In Windows Xp .

You can right-click a folder to get a list of actions you can apply to it. Here?s a way to create an action on that right-click menu that opens a command prompt window with that folder as the current directory. In a text editor such as Notepad, type the following exactly:

Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00

[HKEY_CLASSES_ROOTFoldershellCmd Here]

@=?Command &Prompt Here?

[HKEY_CLASSES-ROOTFoldershellCmd Herecommand]

@=?cmd.exe /k pushd %L?

Save the file with any name you want, with a .reg extension. Then double-click the saved file and choose Yes to merge the file?s information into the Registry. You can delete the file. Right-click any folder and you?ll see the CommandPrompt Here option.

Now you’ll be able to How To Create a right-click command prompt option In Windows Xp.

About the Author

Sheraz Butt is a freelance writer whose articles have appear in most major ezines. You can find more of these at: http://www.sbarticlezone.blogspot.com/

Erase the swap file at shutdown In Xp

If you’re looking for information on Erase the swap file at shutdown In Xp , then pull up a chair and buckle down,because this is the article that you’ve been looking for.

In this article, we’re going to talking about Erase the swap file at shutdown In Xp .

You might be concerned about someone browsing your users? swap files and gathering up little bits of their sensitive data. A remote possibility, to be sure, but it could happen. For that extra measure of security,

go to:

HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINESystemCurrentControlSetControlSession ManagerMemory Management

Set the ClearPageFileAtShutdown DWORD to 1. This will make shutdowns take longer, because it overwrites everything in the swap file with zeroes. Don?t turn this feature on unless you have a serious security threat.

Restart System.

Now you’ll be able to Erase the swap file at shutdown In Xp .

About the Author

Sheraz Butt is a freelance writer whose articles have appear in most major ezines. You can find more of these at: http://www.sbarticlezone.blogspot.com/

How To Change the desktop cleanup frequency In Xp

If you’re looking for information on How To Change the desktop cleanup frequency In Xp , then pull up a chair and buckle down,because this is the article that you’ve been looking for.

In this article, we’re going to talking about How To Change the desktop cleanup frequency In Xp.

Through Display Properties (Desktop tab, Customize Desktop button, General ta, you can turn on and off a feature that runs the Desktop Cleanup Wizard every 60 days. You don?t have an option to set a different interval there, but you can change the interval in the Registry. To do so,

go to:

HKEY_CURRENT_USERSoftwareMicrosoftWindowsCurrentVersionExplorerDesktopCleanupWiz

Change the Days Between Clean Up Value to some other number of days (in decimal format).

Restart System.

Now you’ll be able to How To Change the desktop cleanup frequency In Xp.

How To Uninstall Programs Manually In Windows Xp

If you’re looking for information on How To Uninstall Programs Manually In Windows Xp , then pull up a chair and buckle down,because this is the article that you’ve been looking for.

In this article, we’re going to talking about How To Uninstall Programs Manually In Windows Xp .

Just because Windows XP has the Add/Remove Programs feature it doesn't mean your application will appear in the list. Furthermore, even if it does appear, it's no guarantee that the uninstall feature will work. When you run across one of these situations the items listed below will help in getting rid of the application. Be aware that these steps may not remove everything associated with the application and can impact other applications on the computer. Have a backup or restore point and use caution.

Find the directory for the application and delete all the files in the directory. Delete the directory.

Open regedit and navigate to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINESOFTWARE and find the folder for the

application. Delete the folder.

Open regedit and navigate to HKEY_CURRENT_USERSOFTWARE and find the folder for the application. Delete the folder.

To remove the application entry from Add/Remove Programs (if present) open regedit and

navigate to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINESOFTWAREMicrosoftWindowsCurrentVersionUninstall and find

the folder for the application. Delete the folder.

Some applications have Services attached to them. If this is the case, navigate to

HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINESystemCurrentControlSetServices, locate and delete the service.

In Windows Explorer, navigate to the individual user settings and delete program

references. Common places to check would be:

Cocuments and SettingsAll UsersStart MenuPrograms and delete relevant entries.

Cocuments and SettingsAll UsersStart MenuProgramsStartup and delete relevant

entries.

Cocuments and Settings%YourUserID%Start MenuPrograms and delete relevant entries.

[Do this for each User ID listed]

Cocuments and Settings%YourUserID%Start MenuProgramsStartup and delete relevant

entries.

[Do this for each User ID listed]

If no entries were found in the previous step and the application launches automatically, navigate to

HKEY_CURRENT_USERSoftwareMicrosoftWindows NTCurrentVersionWindows
and delete the entry.

Now you’ll be able to How To Uninstall Programs Manually In Windows Xp.

Labels: Registry Tweaks

Enable/Disable System Properties Access from My Computer

How To Enable/Disable System Properties Access from My Computer In Windows Xp

If you’re looking for information on How To Enable/Disable System Properties Access from My Computer In Windows Xp , then pull up a chair and buckle down,because this is the article that you’ve been looking for.

In this article, we’re going to talking about How To Enable/Disable System Properties Access from
My Computer In Windows Xp .

This tweak removes access to System Properties via My Computer as well as via Control Panel.

Performing the following steps:

[Start] [Run] [Regedit]

Navigate the following key from left pane

HKEY_CURRENT_USERSoftwareMicrosoftWindowsCurrentVersionPoliciesExplorer

Modify/Create DWORD Value of Data type REG_DWORD Named [NoPropertiesMyComputer]
Value Data: [0 - Display Properties / 1 - Hide Properties]

Restart System.

Now you’ll be able to How To Enable/Disable System Properties Access from My Computer In
Windows Xp .

How To Enable/Disable Run Commands Specific to the Registry

If you’re looking for information on How To Enable/Disable Run Commands Specific to the Registry In Xp , then pull up a chair and buckle down,because this is the article that you’ve been looking for.

In this article, we’re going to talking about How To Enable/Disable Run Commands Specific to the Registry In Xp.

This tweak controls the use of the Run command on the local machine.

Performing the following steps:

[Start] [Run] [Regedit]

Navigate the following key from left pane

HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINESoftwareMicrosoftWindowsCurrentVersion PoliciesExplorer

Create a DWORD value of Data Type REG_DWORD for each Run function that will be disabled.

Modify/Create the Value Name [DisableLocalMachineRun]
Modify/Create the Value Name [DisableLocalMachineRunOnce]

Modify/Create the Value Name [DisableCurrentUserRun]
Modify/Create the Value Name [DisableCurrentUserRunOnce]

Setting for Value Data: [0 = Disabled / 1 = Enabled]

Restart System.

Now you’ll be able to How To Enable/Disable Run Commands Specific to the Registry In Xp.

About the Author

How To Modify Control Panel Categories In Windows Xp

If you’re looking for information on How To Modify Control Panel Categories In Windows Xp , then pull up a chair and buckle down,because this is the article that you’ve been looking for.

In this article, we’re going to talking about How To Modify Control Panel Categories In Windows Xp .

Even if you like the new style for Control Panel, you might at times wish you could shift some items around into a different category. It's possible.

Performing the following steps:

[Start] [Run] [Regedit]

Navigate the following key from left pane

HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINESOFTWAREMicrosoftWindowsCurrentVersionControl PanelExtended Properties{305CA226-D286-468e-B848-2B2E8E697B74} 2

Modify/Create DWORD Value of Data type REG_DWORD Named [Choose one of the applets with .cpl extension]

Setting for Value Data: [Select the value from table below]

Other Control Panel Options 0
Appearance and Themes 1
Printers and Other Hardware 2
Network and Internet Connections 3
Sounds, Speed, and Audio Devices 4
Performance and Maintenance 5
Date, Time, Language, and Regional Options 6
Accessibility Options 7
Add or Remove Programs 8
User Accounts 9

Restart System.

To further customize the items that appear in the new Control Panel, do a search of your system for all files that end in .cpl extension. If they aren't already listed, you can add them with a new DWORD value and then assign them to a category of your choosing.

Now you’ll be able to How To Modify Control Panel Categories In Windows Xp.

About the Author

Sheraz Butt is a freelance writer whose articles have appear in most major ezines. You can find more of these at: http://www.sbarticlezone.blogspot.com/

Auto Reboot Windows Xp on System Crash

If you’re looking for information on Auto Reboot Windows Xp on System Crash, then pull up a chair and buckle down,because this is the article that you’ve been looking for.

In this article, we’re going to talking about Auto Reboot Windows Xp on System Crash.
By default, when the Windows XP operating system crashes an automatic reboot of the system occurs. While this behavior can be convenient, the downside is the error message accompanying the crash is not visible. Often times this information can be a great help in troubleshooting the source of the crash. This behavior can be modified in two ways; via the registry or using the System Properties property sheet.

Performing the following steps:

[Start] [Run] [Regedit]

Navigate the following key from left pane

HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINESYSTEMCurrentControlSetControlCrashControl

Modify/Create DWORD Value of Data type REG_DWORD Named [AutoReboot]
Setting for Value Data: [0 = AutoReboot Disabled / 1 = AutoReboot Enabled]

Restart System.

Open System Properties via Start > Control Panel > Performance and Maintenance > System [System Properties may also be opened using the WinKey+Pause key combination]Select the Advanced tab and then click Settings in the Startup and Recovery section In System Failure section, clear the checkbox next to Automatically Restart Click OK and OK to exit .

Now you’ll be able to Auto Reboot Windows Xp on System Crash.

About the Author

Sheraz Butt is a freelance writer whose articles have appear in most major ezines. You can find more of these at: http://www.sbarticlezone.blogspot.com/

Steam Mop cleaning Recalled by Conair Corp

A steam mop ultra modern design ideal for washing and disinfecting floors, carpet or other surface washable. The forward diffusion of the vapor allows easy cleaning of vertical corners and surfaces such as baseboards. The EZ1 has a pressurized boiler to create a lot of steam. It is ideal for medium and large and easily removes dirt through the power of

Learn more

The pressurized stainless steel boiler generates steam at 130 degrees Celsius and allows you to distribute steam order in addition to that which escapes in the mop. The result is a steam mop that cleans better and dries faster.

FEATURES:

Stainless steel boiler.

Power of 1200 watts, 3.5 bar pressure tank 0.5 L.

Vapor diffusion button forwardly.

Steam is automatically released through the bottom of the mop as you rotate the handle and stops when one does not move.

Booster Steam: Steam Booster technology produces a constant flow of steam.

Indicator light: red light when the power is on, green light when the steam is ready.

Accessories included: 2 washable microfiber pads for floors, carpets for a slider, a washable microfiber pad mat, a water tank and a storage base.
